physicalDescription.extent: 18 x 12 x 3 cm (textblock) 18 x 12 cm (board) and 18 x 35 cm (complete binding)

mods.abstract: Incomplete copy of the Quran that begins with verse 2:17
mods.note: M. Krek, "Islamic Manuscripts in North American Libraries: Part 5 - Union Theological Seminary Library," MELA Notes, no. 36 (Fall 1985), p. 4 s.v. 2
The scribe names himself in the dated colophon. There are no marginal notes and neither seal impressions nor ownership notes

Physical Description of item from which images are taken: no endpapers 3 detached flyleaves: 1 at the beginning and 2 at the end 301 fols. with pencilled foliation in western numerals at least 2 fols. of the original textblock are missing at the beginning (that is: verses 1:1 - 2:16) manuscript is too tightly bound to determine the gatherings machine-made wove paper 17.8 x 11.8 cm rubrication illumination blind-tooled and gilt-painted leather binding with flap that is contemporary with the textblock
Reference: Christopher de Hamel, Cutting up Manuscripts for Pleasure and Profit, Charlottesville, Va. 2000
